recipe.title: Dosa
recipe.ingredients: 2 cups short-grain rice ½ cup urad dal (split husked black lentils) 1 tsp fenugreek seeds ½ tsp salt Vegetable oil, for frying

3 tbsp vegetable oil 1 tsp mustard seeds ½ tsp cumin seeds 1 medium onion, diced 1 red pepper, chopped into 1cm pieces ½ tsp salt ½ tsp turmeric Pinch asafetida 1 tbsp grated ginger 6-8 curry leaves 4 garlic cloves, minced 6 small-medium potatoes, boiled, peeled and cubed 3 small sweet potatoes, boiled, peeled and cubed

method.step: Make dosa batter: rinse rice in a bowl, then cover with 4 cups cold water. Rinse urad dal and fenugreek seeds in a small bowl, then add cold water to cover. Leave both to soak for 4-6 hours.
Separately drain rice and dal-fenugreek mixtures. Put rice in food processor, add 1 cup cold water, grind to smooth paste (may have to work in batches). Repeat with the dal-fenugreek mixture.

Combine both pastes in a medium mixing bowl. Whisk together, adding enough water to obtain a medium-thick batter. Cover bowl with kitchen towel and set in a warm place. Let ferment until the surface is bubbly, about 8 hours. Stir in the salt. Use batter straight away or refrigerate for later use (batter will keep for up to a week refrigerated. Thin with water if necessary before proceeding).
Make potato filling: Parboil the potatoes

Put oil in wide skillet over medium heat. When oil is wavy, add cumin and mustard seeds. Wait for seeds to pop, about 1 min, then add red pepper and onion. Stir until onions have softened, about 5 min. Season lightly with salt. Add turmeric, asafetida, ginger, curry leaves, and garlic. Sit to coat and let sizzle for 1 min.

Add potatoes and ½ cup water. Cook, stirring well to combine, until liquid has evaporated ~5min. Mash potatoes a bit with the back of a wooden spoon. Season well with salt, then set aside at room temperature (potato filling can be prepared a day in advance)

Make dosa: set cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Brush with vegetable oil/butter. Ladle ¼ cup batter in the centre of the skillet, and using bottom of ladle, quickly spread batter outwards in circular motion to a diameter of ~7inches. Drizzle ½ tsp oil over the top. Leave dosa batter to brown gradually until outer edges begin to look dry ~2min, cooking one side only. Spoon ½ cup potato filling on top of dosa in the centre as a strip and fold dosa to make cylindrical shape. Serve immediately. Continue making dosa one at a time.
